intro: Huttonella juncea, commonly known as the slender goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a low-growing habit and produces small, daisy-like blooms. Huttonella juncea is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in disturbed areas.
